means: 无法无天，反政府的恐怖活动

sentence.Network_en: He advocated anarchism as the answer to social problems.
sentence.Network_cn: 他提倡以无政府主义来解决社会问题。

sentence.Network_en: His novels were celebrations of anarchism.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的小说颂扬无政府主义.

sentence.Network_en: Wolff calls this view " philosophical anarchism. "
sentence.Network_cn: 沃尔夫将这种观点称为 “ 哲学无政府主义 ”.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... amphicar 水陆两用车 anarchism 无政府主义 anharmonic 不和谐的.
安那其主义（Anarchism）通用的名词是“无政府主义”。根据英文字典里的解释，有正反两方面的意义。
不纳税是无政府主义的表现（Anarchism）。在无政府的情况下，很多服务大众的目标是无法实现的，比如修建公共设施，如公路、桥 …

...左翼无政府主义(Left anarchism 或 left-wing anarchism)指的是左派的无政府主义。它假定未来社会私有制将被互慧和无社会阶层|阶层社会所取代。Peacock, Adrian. 1999. Two Hundred Pharaohs, Five Billion Slaves. Ellipsis London</r.
政治意识形态... ... 1.4 宗教无政府主义（ Religious anarchism） 1.5 社会无政府主义（ Social anarchism） 6.2 国家主义（ Statism）.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Greek anarkhos 'without a chief' (see anarchy) + -ism; later influenced by French anarchisme

entry.def: Anarchism is the belief that the laws and power of governments should be replaced by people working together freely.

example.ex: He advocated anarchism as the answer to social problems.
example.tran: 他提倡以无政府主义来解决社会问题。

means.word_mean: 1. a political theory favoring the abolition of governments

auth_sentence.content: In some ways, Grillo and Casaleggio are reviving the old dream of anarchism: a self-governing world.
auth_sentence.res_content: In some ways, Grillo and Casaleggio are reviving the old dream of anarchism: a self-governing world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In some ways, Grillo and Casaleggio are reviving the old dream of anarchism: a self-governing world.

auth_sentence.content: Living anarchism day to day, the revolutionaries created what Green calls an alternative intellectual and moral world.
auth_sentence.res_content: Living anarchism day to day, the revolutionaries created what Green calls an alternative intellectual and moral world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Living anarchism day to day, the revolutionaries created what Green calls an alternative intellectual and moral world.

auth_sentence.content: Depending on the date and the speaker, it was called anarchism, socialism, communism, or some combination of the terms.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bow,表示"弓"; 2. =ruler/rule/chief, 表示"统治者,统治,主要的"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 建筑上的, 建筑学的
stems_affixes.word_buile: architecture[n.建筑学]+al表形容词→adj.建筑上的, 建筑学的

stems_affixes.value_cn: [运动或战争中的]弓箭手,射手
stems_affixes.word_buile: arch弓+er人→n.[运动或战争中的]弓箭手,射手
an无+arch统治者,统治,主要的+ism主义→n.无政府主义
arch统治者,统治,主要的+ive物,表示东西+s复数→统治的东西→统治者的文件→档案
matri母[女性]+arch首脑→n.女族长;女家长
mon=mono单个+arch统治者→一个统治者
patri父亲+arch统治者,统治,主要的→父亲统治→家长
